common

Interface ICommunicate

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote

    public interface ICommunicate
extends java.rmi.Remote
    This interface provides the ability to communicate with a remote chat room. There should be one ICommunicate object per room per person. Note that this is an RMI server object and should be treated as such; this object should NEVER be sent in its entirety, but rather stubbified before sending.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      provided.datapacket.DataPacket<IConnect,ICommunicate> getIConnect()
      Returns the IConnect stub of this user.
      provided.datapacket.DataPacket<java.lang.String,ICommunicate> getUserInfo()
      Gets the preferred name for a user within a given chat.
      void sendMsg(provided.datapacket.DataPacket<?,ICommunicate> data)
      Sends a message to the group chat represented by this ICommunicate object.

    • Method Detail

      • getIConnect

        provided.datapacket.DataPacket<IConnect,ICommunicate> getIConnect()
        Returns the IConnect stub of this user. For use in "auto-connect" back

      • getUserInfo

        provided.datapacket.DataPacket<java.lang.String,ICommunicate> getUserInfo()
                                                                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Gets the preferred name for a user within a given chat.
        Returns:
        String of the user's preferred name
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - in the case that there is some error sending the message

      • sendMsg

        void sendMsg(provided.datapacket.DataPacket<?,ICommunicate> data)
      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Sends a message to the group chat represented by this ICommunicate object.
        Parameters:
        data - - the message to be sent
        Throws:
